Chart.Name: Ability Check
Chart.Description: *House Rule*. Base chance to perform activity that utilizes this ability score. Modifiers: +/-20% Moderate difficulty, +/-40% Hard Difficulty, +/-70% Impossible (plus for decending, minus for ascending)

Column.Name: Base Chance Ascending (roll at or below)
Base Chance Decending (roll at or above)

Chart.Name: AC Modifiers
Chart.Description: Various mofidiers applied to armor class. * only applies of the target has no dexterity bonus to AC.

Chart.Name: Armor Encumbrance
Chart.Description: Encumbrance values for armor types.

Chart.Name: Armor I
Chart.Description: * For non-magic armour. Magic armour is un-encumbering, and allows a maximum move rate 30 ft faster than normal (up to 120 ft). Magic shields weigh as much as normal shields of the same type. OSRIC, p.30

Chart.Name: Armor Rating
Chart.Description: Armor values for armor. OSRIC, p.30

Chart.Name: Assassin Matrix
Chart.Description: Assassin attack progression.

Chart.Name: Assassin Saves
Chart.Description: Assassin saving throw chart.

Chart.Name: Charisma Chart
Chart.Description: Charisma adjustment chart.

Chart.Name: Cleric Experience
Chart.Description: Cleric level progression. * Constitution hp adjustments no longer apply Each level gained thereafter requires 225,000 experience points and grants +2 hit points. OSRIC, p. 10

Chart.Name: Cleric Matrix
Chart.Description: Cleric to hit AC matrix, OSRIC p. 11

Chart.Name: Cleric Saves
Chart.Description: Saving throws for Clerics, Druids/etc.

Chart.Name: Cleric Spell Costs
Chart.Description: List of spells and costs typically charged for NPC to cast for party.

RowList.Row: 500 per level of experience of the recipient
5 per person per level of spell caster
1,000 plus 500 per level of spell caster
10,000 plus a like amount per level of experience of the recipient

Chart.Name: Cleric Spells Gained
Chart.Description: Cleric spells gained per level.

Chart.Name: Cleric Turn Undead
Chart.Description: Normally 2d6 creatures are affected by Turn Undead. Exceptions are paladins and Type 13 creatures, of which only 1d2 are affected, and results of “D”, which affect 1d6+6 creatures. Turning lasts for 3d4 rounds. OSRIC, p. 123

Chart.Name: Common Healing Results
Chart.Description: Ranges for common healing spells and magic items.

Chart.Name: Constitution Chart
Chart.Description: Adjustments for constitution scores, OSRIC p. 359

Chart.Name: Container Capacity
Chart.Description: Various containers max capacity in gp.

Chart.Name: Cover and Concealment
Chart.Description: Hard cover will increase chances for saving throws as noted. Cover equal to 90% (or better) will also give the target creatures the benefit of no damage whatsoever if the appropriate saving throw is successful.

Chart.Name: Detect Invisible
Chart.Description: Note: You may give unintelligent creatures with keen hearing or sense of smell the equivalent of intelligence to reflect detection of invisible creatures. Check each round the creature is exposed to invisibility. Once detected, the invisible creature will be kept track of thereafter, as the detector will be able to note the cause. Any attacks incur the -4 penalty of attacking an invisible opponent, of course, and the invisible creature likewise is entitled to +4 on saving throws.

Chart.Name: Dexterity Chart
Chart.Description: Dexterity score adjustments, OSRIC P 359

Chart.Name: Druid Matrix
Chart.Description: Druid to hit AC table, OSRIC p. 12

Chart.Name: Druid Saves
Chart.Description: Saving throws for druids.

Chart.Name: Dwarvish Detections
Chart.Description: Racial abilities of dwarves to detect underground features.

RowList.Row: Detect the existence of new construction
Detect sliding or shifting rooms or walls

Chart.Name: Encounter Reaction
Chart.Description: Reaction is determined by rolling percentile dice, adjusting the score for charisma and applicable loyalty adjustment as if the creature were a henchman of the character speaking, and the modified score of the percentile dice is compared to the table. * Or morale check if appropriate.

Chart.Name: Encumbrance
Chart.Description: Encumbrance for characters in GP.

Chart.Name: Fighter Matrix
Chart.Description: Fighter to hit AC chart.

Chart.Name: Fighter Saves
Chart.Description: Fighter/Monster Saves, OSRIC, p.363. Non-intelligent monsters save at 1/2 HD except for poison/death.

Chart.Name: Gaze/Eye Attack
Chart.Description: The chances of someone meeting the gaze of a creature with gaze attacks.

Chart.Name: Grapple Attack Modifiers
Chart.Description: Base chance to hit. Multiply attacker’s armor class by 10, ignoring magical devices (bracers, cloaks, rings, etc.), but adding 1 for each + 1 of magical armor, to find a percentage chance from 100% to 0%. Example plate armor ac3, would be 30%, +1 plate armor would be 31%. Note: The attacker cannot grapple if either or both hands are holding anything.

Chart.Name: Grapple Result
Chart.Description: Any hold shown remains in effect from round to round unless the target scores a higher percentage hold. Damage accrues until a hold is broken or until the holder elects to try for a different hold. The target may still inflict damage by lesser hold results shown after the double slashes (//). These might result in both opponents falling to the ground and continuing their grappling there. Note: If the opponent is stunned, a second attack may immediately be made, and the stunned opponent cannot counter for 1 round.

Chart.Name: Grapple Result Modifiers
Chart.Description: In each round of grappling combat there will be an attack and a counter. Any existing hold automatically goes first until broken. Once it is determined that a grappling attack succeeds, the percentile dice must be rolled again to find what hold is gained.

RowList.Row: Target wearing banded or plate mail

Chart.Name: Hear Noise
Chart.Description: Chances to hear noise when listening.

Chart.Name: Hit Modifiers
Chart.Description: * dex and shield do not apply. ** shield does not apply.

RowList.Row: opponent off balance, encumbered, held by one leg
opponent stunned, held by both legs, slowed
Dwarf vs. Half-orcs, Orcs, Goblins and Hobgoblins

Chart.Name: Hurled Weapons and Missiles
Chart.Description: * Heavy crossbows may not be used from horseback; only a footman can brace them correctly before firing. † Some specially-made bows (sold at special cost if at all—GM’s discretion) permit the user to add his or her strength bonus to damage inflicted with the weapon. Otherwise the strength damage bonus with missile weapons is restricted to hurled weapons (axes, ham-mers, clubs, darts, javelins and spears). OSRIC, p. 29

Column.Name: rate of Fire (in shots per round)

Chart.Name: Intelligence Chart
Chart.Description: Intelligence adjustments.

Chart.Name: Item Saves
Chart.Description: Saving throws for items. Source OSRIC, p372

Chart.Name: Light Sources
Chart.Description: Duration, range of different light sources.* Illumination is from burning 1 pot (pint) of fine oil. ** Illumination is 1” wide only and can be masked by shutter.

Chart.Name: Magic-User Experience
Chart.Description: Magic-User level progression. * Constitution-based hp adjustments no longer apply. Each level gained thereafter requires 375,000 experience points and grants +1 hit point. OSRIC, p. 16

Chart.Name: Magic-User Matrix
Chart.Description: Magic-user to hit table. OSRIC, p.17

Chart.Name: Magic-User Saves
Chart.Description: Saving throws for magic-users

Chart.Name: Magic-User Spell Acquisition
Chart.Description: Chance to know spells and min/max number

Chart.Name: Magic-User Spells Gained
Chart.Description: Magic-user spells gained per level.

Chart.Name: Melee Weapons
Chart.Description: Melee Weapon type versus Armor, Size, Space, Speed, Damage

Chart.Name: Missiles Range/Fire Rate
Chart.Description: Hurled weapons range and fire rates. Missiles are -5 at long range, -2 at medium.

Chart.Name: Monster Attack Matrix
Chart.Description: Attack matrix used for monsters or creatures. Any + above 3 equals another HD, missiles are -5 at long range, -2 at medium. *DO NOT RENAME OR DELETE THIS CHART*

Chart.Name: Monster BaB Matrix
Chart.Description: Monster base attack bonuse. Used if using d20 mode in settings. *DO NOT RENAME OR DELETE THIS CHART*

Chart.Name: Monster HD to Level
Chart.Description: Monster HD to Level Chart, OSRIC, p123

Chart.Name: Monster Saves
Chart.Description: Saving throws used for monster or creatures. *DO NOT DELETE OR RENAME THIS CHART*

Chart.Name: Monster THACO Matrix
Chart.Description: Monster THACOs. Used if using THACO attack in settings. *DO NOT RENAME OR DELETE THIS CHART*

Chart.Name: Monster XP Value
Chart.Description: Experience value of monster based on HD, level and abilities.

Chart.Name: Morale Check
Chart.Description: Morale Check modifiers, base is 50% +5% per HD with the listed adjustments. OSRIC, p.125

RowList.Row: Per friend killed, surrendered or fled
Own side greatly outnumbered (2-1 or more)
Per foe killed, surrendered or fled

Chart.Name: Overbear Attack Modifiers
Chart.Description: Base chance to hit. Multiply attacker’s armor class by 10, ignoring magical devices (bracers, cloaks, rings, etc.), but adding 1 for each + 1 of magical armor, to find a percentage chance from 100% to 0%. Example plate armor ac3, would be 30%, +1 plate armor would be 31%. Note: The attacker can have either or both hands otherwise employed.

Chart.Name: Overbear Result Modifiers
Chart.Description: Once an opponent is overborne, some other form of combat MUST take place.

RowList.Row: target stunned or both feet held

Chart.Name: Overbear Results
Chart.Description: Once an opponent is overborne, some other form of combat MUST take place.

RowList.Row: bounce off or avoided, target may try
target knocked to hands and knees
target knocked flat, stunned for 1 round

Chart.Name: Paladin Saves
Chart.Description: Paladin saving throw table. OSRIC, p.19

Chart.Name: Poison, Ingestive
Chart.Description: * Saving throw at +4, chance of tasting/smelling/seeing poison 80%. ** Saving throw at +3, chance of tasting/smelling/seeing poison 65%. *** Saving throw at +2, chance of tasting/smelling/seeing poison 40%. **** Saving throw at + 1, chance of tasting/smelling/seeing poison 15%.

Chart.Name: Poison, Insinuative
Chart.Description: * Saving throw at +4, chance of tasting/smelling/seeing poison 80%. ** Saving throw at +3, chance of tasting/smelling/seeing poison 65%. *** Saving throw at +2, chance of tasting/smelling/seeing poison 40%. **** Saving throw at + 1, chance of tasting/smelling/seeing poison 15%.

Chart.Name: Pummel Attack Modifier
Chart.Description: The base score on percentile dice is opponent AC value times 10 to arrive at a percentage chance to hit, i.e. AC 10 = 100%. AC 9 = 90%. all the way to AC ratings of 0 and minus numbers which indicate no chance or a negative chance to score a hit. Magical protections such as rings, bracers, cloaks, etc. do not count as AC, so ignore them.

RowList.Row: Attacker’s AC, per point (with negative AC being treated as positive)
Target prone w/o shield or ready weapon and/or helpless

Chart.Name: Pummel Result
Chart.Description: * Series ends, determination of next strike must be.made. ** Opponent unable to attack for 1 full round.

Chart.Name: Pummel Results Modifier
Chart.Description: In each round of weaponless melee, there will be two pummeling attacks, and possibly several blows per attack. The attacker determines if a strike is successful, and then whether or not it does any damage and how much, if any. Percentile dice are rolled, and the score is modified as shown below.

RowList.Row: Target per point of dex over 14
Target wearing leather or padded armor
Target wearing chain, ring, scale or studded mail
Target wearing magical cloak or ring
Target wearing banded, plate or splint mail
Target wearing slightly open faced helmet
Target wearing visored or slitted helmet

Chart.Name: Ranged Weapons
Chart.Description: Ranged Weapons vrs Armor, Rate, Range, Damage.

Chart.Name: Ranger Matrix
Chart.Description: Ranger to hit table, OSRIC, p. 22

Chart.Name: Ranger Saves
Chart.Description: Ranger saving throw table, OSRIC, p. 22

Chart.Name: Spell Recovery
Chart.Description: Once rested, magic-users must memorize their spells and clerics must pray and meditate. Allow 15 minutes of game time for memorization or prayer for each spell level. Such activity requires a mind rested by a good sleep and nourished by the body

Chart.Name: Strength Chart
Chart.Description: Adjustments for high strength scores, OSRIC p 359

Column.Name: Minor tests, e.g. forcing doors (chance on d6)
Major tests, e.g. bending bars and lifting portcullis (chance on d%)

Chart.Name: Thief Backstab
Chart.Description: Thieves make their backstab attack at +4 to hit. Do not include bonus from strength or magic weapons when multiplying damage.

Chart.Name: Thief Matrix
Chart.Description: Thief to hit table, OSRIC, p.25

Chart.Name: Thief Saves
Chart.Description: Saving Throws for thief.

Chart.Name: Thief Skills
Chart.Description: Base chance to perform thief abilities for each level.

Chart.Name: Weapon I
Chart.Description: * Long-hafted, pointed weapons, such as the spear, lance (when used dismounted), pole arm, or trident, inflict double damage when set to receive a charge and the foe actually charges. The lance inflicts double damage when used by a character riding a charging heavy warhorse or similar animal; if the attacker is mounted on a normal riding or cavalry horse, the damage should be reduced. OSRIC, p. 29

Chart.Name: Weapon II
Chart.Description: Weapons damage, space, weight stats.

Chart.Name: Wisdom Bonus Spells
Chart.Description: Additional spells granted for high wisdom.

Chart.Name: Wisdom Chart
Chart.Description: Wisdom ability score adjustments.
